page.title: 14Churches in the Rodings
page.content: There are four churches in our area, three are Church of England Churches and one is a Congregational Church. St.Martin's Church is in White Roding, It was built nearly 900 years ago, probably just before the Norman Conquest. It is the largest of the Roding Churches, and the name of the village is usually attributed to the white colour of the rubble of which the Church was built. St. Micheal and All Angels Church is in Leaden Roding. Leaden is thought to have been so named because the church was the first in the area to have a lead roof. It is the oldest in the Roding's group some of it dating from the latter part of the 11th century.It is a small building in the Norman style.The Congregational Church is in White Roding. St.Mary's Church in Aythorpe Roding was bulit in the 13th. Century.
